intro: Marsdenia connivens, commonly known as the white-flowered Marsdenia, is a species of flowering plant in the Apocynaceae family. It is native to Southeast Asia, including countries like Thailand and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and clusters of small, white, tubular flowers. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and often have a slightly waxy texture. Marsdenia connivens is typically found in humid, shaded environments such as forest understories.
